questions.question: 1. Maximum pressure stress theory is applicable for:

explanations.a: Incorrect. Maximum principal stress theory is not suitable for ductile materials.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Different failure theories apply to ductile and brittle materials separately.
explanations.c: Correct. Maximum principal stress (Rankineâ€™s theory) is applicable to brittle materials.
explanations.d: Incorrect. One of the listed options is correct.

questions.question: 2. Shear stress theory is applicable for:

explanations.a: Correct. Maximum shear stress theory (Tresca theory) is mainly applicable to ductile materials.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Brittle materials fail due to normal stress rather than shear stress.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Shear stress theory is primarily for ductile materials.
explanations.d: Incorrect. One of the listed options is correct.

questions.question: 4. The following type of nut is used with allen bolt:

explanations.a: Incorrect. Slotted nuts are used where locking arrangements are required.
explanations.b: Incorrect. There is no standard term called an 'Allen nut'.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Allen bolts do not require a specific nut type.
explanations.d: Correct. Allen bolts can be used with various types of nuts depending on application.

questions.question: 5. How many types of screw thread:

explanations.a: Incorrect. While there are many thread forms, the commonly classified basic types are fewer.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Four is not the standard basic classification count.
explanations.c: Correct. Screw threads are commonly classified into three basic types: V-thread, square thread, and trapezoidal thread.
explanations.d: Incorrect. There are more than two basic thread types.
